instruction: Give me a list of 5 words where the letters of the words are in alphabetical order. One example: "doors". "d" comes before "o", "o" comes before "r", and "r" comes before "s".
output:
1. "Alphabetical" - This word is a perfect example of a word where the letters are in alphabetical order. It starts with "A", then "L", "P", "H", "A", "B", "E", "T", "I", "C", "A", "L" and ends with "L".

2. "Chemical" - This word starts with "C", then "H", "E", "M", "I", "C", "A" and ends with "L".

3. "Chronological" - This word starts with "C", then "H", "R", "O", "N", "O", "L", "O", "G", "I", "C" and ends with "L".

4. "Educational" - This word starts with "E", then "D", "U", "C", "A", "T", "I", "O", "N", "A" and ends with "L".

5. "Geographical" - This word starts with "G", then "E", "O", "G", "R", "A", "P", "H", "I", "C", "A" and ends with "L".

These are just a few examples of words where the letters are in alphabetical order. There are many more out there!
